runs.comm: slides the first ball down the leg side and India are away with a wide.

he's a punchy player who loves to go after anything off-line. Just like that. Short and wide outside off, the pitch is really slow and the ball sits up for Parthiv to slam away to the left of cover for four.
better line, gets one to jump up from back of a length at Parthiv who prods at it from the crease.
fractionally wide of off stump, Parthiv slashes with mighty fierceness, but misses.
full ball on leg stump, Parthiv moves into the on-drive nicely but finds mid-on.
short of a length outside off, Parthiv dabs it down to third man.
this one nips into Rahane from back of a length, and it dribbles off the pad to the off side. Parthiv is alert to the single and India pinch a leg-bye. Young blood in the legs!
ooh, Parthiv had to hurry back after running halfway down. Rahane forced it off the back foot to point, but it went straight to the fielder who had a shy and missed.
not a bad way to get your first runs for India! Rahane stands up, opens the wrists and hoists a back of length ball majestically over cover-point,. Solid wrist work there.
short of a length outside off, Rahane drops it into the covers for a single.
138 kph, but Parthiv seemed to have all the time he needed to work that off the pads round the corner to deep square leg.
they get there eventually. Rahane steers softly to the left of point, Parthiv was always coming and Rahane eventually responded by the time Morgan tumbled, collected and threw.
smart little offcutter at 112 kph, Parthiv spots it, but the timing is a little awry as he whips straight to mid-on

whoa, that's not how Rahane got that first-class average in the mid 60s. Short of a length outside off and not there for the drive, but he just looks to dropkick it on the up over long-off. Doesn't succeed, he misses it by some distance.
hooka! An Indian batsman who plays the hook. Short ball going down the leg side, Rahane goes up and over, almost all the way over fine leg. A touch of top edge in that, but he picked up the gap well.
and the single straight away. Again he eases a back of length ball into the covers for one.
138 kph, short and quick, Parthiv was really late on that but went for the pull nevertheless, with a vengeance. It took a healthy top edge and flew over slip's head.
Parthiv gets behind the line this time and steers into the covers.
Parthiv charges out of the blocks and goes for a reckless swipe through the leg side! Bresnan beats him for pace outside off.
over-pitched on the pads, Rahane flicks without a fuss through midwicket for two.

take that! Broad tries a bit of old-school enforcing. Short and aimed at the head, but it was going down the leg side. Rahane pounces on it with another very good-looking pull. It lands just short of the fence at deep backward square leg.

Rahane escapes a run out chance now. He tried to nudge a short of length ball into the leg side and steal a single, but the ball went no where and Broad was on to it immediately on his follow through. Rahane was caught a few yards out of the crease as Broad sprawled ahead and shied under-hand. And he misses!

Broad needs a reworking of the lines here. Another one on the pads, and Rahane is putting on display a flick that has class written all over it. This could be one of the defining strokes in Indian cricket in the coming years.
back of a length on off stump, Rahane once again shows good awareness, tapping into the off side for a single.
Parthiv moves around rampantly on the crease, but cramps himself for room as Broad keeps it tight on middle and leg.
The Indians have arrived. Four Tests late, but finally they might just be here. Rahane sets himself up, eyes a short ball from Dernbach and slams it mighty over midwicket.
a gem of a slower ball that, came out of the back of the hand, floated for an eternity in the air and landed full on middle and off. Rahane barely spotted it and played it to the leg side.
another slower one, Rahane picks it this time and works it to the leg side for one.

mistimed and gone. Parthiv holes out to another slower ball. It was landed on a length, and deviated away from Parthiv who looked to swipe it across through the straight field. It takes the top egde, spirals up into the air and comes down safely into mid-on's hands.
short of a length outside off, Dravid taps into the off side from the crease.
whoa, Dravid gets his first T20 runs in ungainly fashion as Dernbach gets one to jump up viciously from a length. He gloves it away from the slip for a single.
and he cramps Dravid for room as he looks to drive into the off side. Played defensively into the covers.
Dravid tries to swing one away to the leg side, but it is through him.
he's played four Tests, all beautiful shots, and in five T20 balls, he's produced three ugly shots already. He looks to hoick into the leg side again, and inner edges it to short fine leg.
145.6 kph, short and fast, but Rahane still goes for the pull. He mistimes it though, and it goes to mid-on. Good over this for England, so far.
this time he latches on. He's going after these fastish short balls and getting away with them. Pulled away high and easy over square leg.
Ok, not a good over for England any more! Rahane is taking them on here. He marches out of the crease this time and scythes Broad on the up over the covers.
tight line on middle and leg, Dravid can't get the cut away
tossed up, Dravid drives to long-on for a single. India have 50
back of a length to Rahane who dabs another single to long-on.
Dravid comes out of the crease, but isn't to the pitch. He still gets the single away through mid-on.
innovative from Rahane, he hangs back in the crease to a short ball and chips it intentionally over the covers for a couple.
another chip shot, he goes over mid-on this time and gets a single to retain strike.
tossed up on middle and leg, Rahane drives to long-on for one.
turns into Dravid from outside off and he guides the cut into the deep for one more.
the Rahane exhibition continues. India's got talent. He skips out again, gets close to the pitch and then does some subcontinental magic with the wrists to send the ball packing through the covers.
even better, he hangs back this time as Swann shortens the length and dabs him late through third man. Fine shot, in more ways than one.
tosses up again, Rahane drives down the ground for a single.
Kieswetter fluffs a straight forward stumping! Dravid charges out, and is beaten by the floater that drifts away outside off. The keeper can't collect.
this time Dravid gets bat on it as he jumps out and drives down the grounf. He's not timing them too well so far, but a single this time.
lands on leg and turns across sharply, Rahane is beaten by the extra turn ...
short of a length on the pads, he nudges through square leg for one.
Dravid advances again and gets close to the flight, but not quite. He chips it intentionally short of the man at long-off for a single
A fifty on debut! Rahane has looked majestic today. He hangs back and works against the spin through midwicket and charges back like a man possessed for the second.
fuller from Samit, Rahane clips through midwicket for another single
Rahane jumps out again, and slams Swann down the ground. Monster work from the man at long-off to cut off the boundary.
he's toying with Swann's lengths here. hangs back and steers through third man with the latest of dabs for a single.
Dravid looking like a fish in a desert here. Looks to slog through the leg side, it doesn't come off and they get a single.
short and wide, Rahane places the cut superbly to pick up a couple to the right of third-man.
Rahane nudges a ball on middle and off with the spin through the leg side.
Dravid's timing has been so poor he can't even mis-hit properly. Another leg side hoick goes wrong, and it doesn't carry to the man at deep midwicket.
fired in on the pads, Dravid again looks to go big over the leg side and inside edges it to short third man for one.
Rahane skips out and drives down the ground for one.
finally Dravid gets a bit of bat on one of these swipes, but still can't find the boundary. Couple taken to midwicket.
Dravid's hit one of the mightiest sixes he has ever hit! That was in the slot, he has had a few sighters and he just bangs it miles over midwicket.
the timing is coming back! Dravid trots out this time and exquisitely launches Samit over long-on for six more.

Dravid's hit three consecutive sixes. I am pinching myself hard. Ouch. I am not dreaming. Bosh! Another flat nothign ball from Russel Peters, and he sure is getting hurt a real bad here. Slg-swept into the crowd behind midwicket again.
Rahane is running almost as well as he is hitting them. Length ball on the stumps, he nudges through midwicket and prances back for the second.
Rahane opens up the off side and scythes into the covers for a single.
Dravid looks to drive into the covers, but picks out the man at cover. The throw is wide, but they can't get the overthrow.

Dravid's T20 batting career began scratchily, slowly got better, climaxed in three stunning sixes, and ends with a catch at cover. Full and there for the butchering, Dravid hits it really well but straight to cover.
short of a length outside off, Kohli works it to midwicket but can't get the single.
offcutter cramps Kohli for room outside off, but he steers into the covers to open his account. First runs in England for him.
back of a length, angling down the leg side, Kohli helps it along to fine leg for one.
slower ball at 119.9 kph, Rahane treats it with respect, driving it back solidly to the bowler.

one debutant goes, and the other follows. Rahane's little fairytale is over. It wasn't really short, as Rahane backed away to the leg side and looked to create room to boom it over the covers. He was still cramped and ended up upper cutting it into third man's hands. Well played young man!
another one on leg stump for Kohli who glances it to fine leg for an easy couple.

India going through a mini-collapse here, Kohli is gone. Short and wide outside off, perhaps too wide outside off for the pull and he ends up nicking it through to the keeper. It hit really low down the bat too.
almost saw it coming. Bouncer, but Broad whangs it in too short. Called wide for height.
Raina plays the periscope pull. Another really short ball, Raina gingerly flaps it across to fine leg, on the bounce.

he got out to Swann 3 times in the Tests, including for a pair at the Oval, but he's hit him for four straight away here. Lovely shot too, he chips out, gets to the flight and drives him inside out through cover.
fuller ball on middle and leg, Raina drives down the ground for one.
tossed up outside off, and the languid Rohit gets it away through midwicket for a single.
tossed up juicily outside off, Raina looks to drive, but can't quite time it. Single down the ground, nevertheless.
lovely stuff, back of a length outside off and breaking in, Rohit pops it to the off side.

boy, did Rohit look lazy there? He dawdles past an offbreak that goes through the bat pad gap, Kieswetter is dozing away as well and doesn't collect it, but he has enough time to make amends as Rohit turns back slowly. India digging the kind of hole they found themselves in several times in the Tests.

what's that? I can't play the bouncer? Take that. You can almost hear Raina muttering those words as he launches a short ball from Broad miles over the deep square leg boundary. Stunning timing on that.
short of a length outside off, Raina taps it into the off side.
he's still stuck on the back foot, always concerned about the pacy bumper. He walks inside the line and looks to nudge down the leg side, but the keeper stops it.
lovely little dab from Raina. Short ball outside off, he waits for it, opens the face and guides it expertly to third man.
he doesn't time it, but does well enough to clear mid-on and steal a couple. Looks to muscle a fullish ball down the ground, and mows it over the top. The slip and leg gully have gone away.
fullish ball outside off to end the over, Raina will be disappointed he could not connect with the steer.
flighted outside off and turning in, Dhoni drives it back to the bowler.
that turned enough to land at Lord's! Dhoni manages to force it to the leg side and pinch a single.
flighted outside off, Raina drives straight to mid-off.
again finds the fielder as he drives a full ball into the covers.
Raina pitches tent and goes for the good old heave-ho through the leg side. Doesn't middle it, but he gets a single to deep midwicket.
flat ball on Dhoni's off stump and he winkles it into the leg side for a single.
Bresnan pushes this one down the leg side. Another spell, another wide to start it off.
short of a length outside off, Dhoni punches it from the crease into the off side.
short ball angling in, Dhoni goes for a furious pull and gets it away off the pad to the leg side.

Give him the blue jersey (or the yellow one) and Raina becomes Superman. Doesn't quite like it when he's in whites. Length ball, in the region, Raina just whacks the leather off it. Tremendous cross-batted clobbering.
even bigger. Visceral. Slower ball on middle and leg, full and in the slot, Raina bombards it over wide long-on. Boy, he's connecting these.
goes very full this time does Bresnan, Raina punches down the ground for one more.
the mini-chopper this. Not quite the helicopter. Dhoni swooshes the bat in a circular arc and lashes the ball out to deep point for a single.
what a poor ball. Angled down the leg side, Raina looks to pull and gets some pad on it and it runs away to fine leg. David Lloyd reckons India will win this easy, given the nature of the track.
speared into the pads, Raina misses one of those swings to the leg side and they get a leg bye to the leg side.
brutal. Dhoni lines up a length ball angling into him and bottom-hands the life out of it. It nearly sails all the way over midwicket despite never taking off.

what an entertaining ball that was to watch! Dhoni is gone, and in dramatic style. He looked to bash this down the ground, got too violent for his own liking and lost the top hand grip on the bat and ended up slicing it one-handed high towards long-on. The debutant Hales was there, he nearly fluffed it as he tried to take it with the fingers pointing up, it popped up and landed on his shoulder, allowing him to grab it before it landed. He eventually exHales in relief.
and he's away with four. Fast and short outside off, Ashwin just waits for it to pass him and angles it along to third man.
Ashwin came, Ashwin went. He dabbed a length ball into the off side, loped out of the crease pointlessly and took for ever to turn back. Dernbach ran through to under-arm the ball onto the stumps.

Another mini-collapse for India. Raina is gone now, and they are eight down. He's played a superb hand though. It was a back of length ball angling across Raina, who tried to launch it over the leg side, but ended up slicing it off the outside edge into the covers.
menacing bouncer that, PK is pushed back into the crease and jabs it to the leg side.
attempted yorker, ends a full toss as PK backs away exposing his castle. He just about manages to get bat on it and squeeze a single to third man.
bouncer to Vinay, who gets nicely behind it and defends. This is what India needed in the Tests.
behind the line again to a short of length ball, and defends it into the off side. India playing for stumps? Not a bad idea, really. They need to play out these 20 overs.
VK gets the single now, stays on the crease and nudges to the leg side. Six balls to go. Can they take it to 170?
short of a length to VK, who forces a single down to long on. Over to Praveen Kamikaze Kumar.
swing and a miss. That was back of a length well outside off, PK swings hard but he is too far away from the ball as he has backed away, and misses.

classy deception! What a pleasing slower ball that was! It was bowled, it spent some time traversing the 22 yards, time in which Praveen set himself up for a straight drive, played it, missed, and thought about attempting another shot. Too late, the ball came through and tapped off stump. Easy peasy.
and Munaf doesn't try to make the most of the chance. India are bowled out in this format too. Short and wide outside off, he swings at it without much intent and nicks through to the keeper.
